extendedIngredients.name: butternut squash
extendedIngredients.original: 4 cups cubed peeled butternut squash (1 small to medium squash)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 cups cubed peeled butternut squash (1 small to medium squash)
extendedIngredients.originalName: cubed peeled butternut squash (1 small to medium squash)

extendedIngredients.name: chicken sausage
extendedIngredients.original: 12 ounces cooked chicken-apple sausage, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 ounces cooked chicken-apple sausage, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: cooked chicken-apple sausage, cut into 1/2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: fresh parsley leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup fresh sage or parsley leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup fresh sage or parsley leaves

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.original: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil

title: Butternut Squash Soup With Chicken Sausage
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the sausage and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a bowl using a slotted spoon. Add the squash, carrots, celery, onion, chicken broth, 2 1/2 cups water and 3/4 teaspoon salt to the pot. Cover and bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and continue simmering until the vegetables are tender, about 15 more minutes.                          Puree the soup in a blender in batches, then return to the pot along with the sausage. Season with salt and pepper and keep warm.                          Heat the remaining 1/3 cup olive oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. When the oil is very hot, add the sage leaves in batches and fry, turning, until dark green and crisp, about 1 minute. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Ladle the soup into bowls and top with the fried sage.                          Photograph by Christopher Testani

steps.step: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add the sausage and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 4 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl using a slotted spoon.

Add the squash, carrots, celery, onion, chicken broth, 2 1/2 cups water and 3/4 teaspoon salt to the pot. Cover and bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and continue simmering until the vegetables are tender, about 15 more minutes.
Puree the soup in a blender in batches, then return to the pot along with the sausage. Season with salt and pepper and keep warm.
Heat the remaining 1/3 cup olive oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. When the oil is very hot, add the sage leaves in batches and fry, turning, until dark green and crisp, about 1 minute.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Ladle the soup into bowls and top with the fried sage.
